```{r setup, include = FALSE, echo = FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(stringr)
library(readxl)
```

```{r loading the data}
xl <- read_excel("data/DRUG_CLASS_I_Mean_Cmax_Trough_Efficacy_R_DATA_ANALYSIS.xlsx")
data1 <- xl[2:12, ]
data2 <- xl[17:26, ]
```

```{r cleaning the data}
data1 <- data1 %>% 
  rename(drug_name = MeanCmaxEfficacy,
         dose = X__1,
         PLA = X__2,
         ULU = X__3,
         RIM = X__4,
         OCS = X__5,
         ICS = X__6,
         SLU = X__7,
         SLE = X__8,
         ELU = X__9,
         ESP = X__10,
         cLogP = X__11,
         huPPB = X__12,
         muPPB = X__13,
         MIC_Erdman = X__14,
         MICserumErd = X__15,
         MIC_Rv = X__16,
         Caseum_binding = X__17,
         MacUptake = X__18) %>% 
  mutate(level = "Cmax")

data2 <- data2 %>% 
  rename(drug_name = MeanCmaxEfficacy,
         dose = X__1,
         PLA = X__2,
         ULU = X__3,
         RIM = X__4,
         OCS = X__5,
         ICS = X__6,
         SLU = X__7,
         SLE = X__8,
         ELU = X__9,
         ESP = X__10,
         cLogP = X__11,
         huPPB = X__12,
         muPPB = X__13,
         MIC_Erdman = X__14,
         MICserumErd = X__15,
         MIC_Rv = X__16,
         Caseum_binding = X__17,
         MacUptake = X__18) %>% 
  mutate(level = "Trough")
```

```{r merging the data}
joined <- full_join(data1, data2, by = c("drug_name", "dose", "level")) ##need to use something besides full_join

##also need to split dose column in to dose_ug and dose_int
```
